intro: Parosela nova, commonly known as the New Zealand parosela, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Parosela nova is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
